body:
Can you add a little more documentation about how `source.entities` and `extract.tables.names` works? It basically seems this is how you specify which tables are going to be pulled in this job?

Ideally the documentation would be in under `gobblin-docs/user-guide/Query-Based-Sources.md` - the new file doesn't have to be a full explanation of the `QueryBasedSource`, just the documentation relevant to these configs, we can fill in the rest of it later.
Just the comments made above, everything else LGTM

hey @jinhyukchang I discussed with @chavdar and everything in this PR looks good! I can merge this PR, but I have one last request.

Can you add some documentation to the Gobblin Docs about this feature, you can probably just copy what you have in your Google Doc. If you have time its always nice to add documentation on configuration keys and documentation on the different plugin points. This is generally useful for any new Gobblin user who wants to write to a RDMS (I already know of one user waiting on this PR because they want to use this).

All Gobblin documentation is checked into GitHub under `gobblin-docs`. I suggest putting the documentation in a new file called `gobblin-docs/user-guide/Gobblin-JDBC-Writer.md`. The format of the files is all in Markdown. It's should be a relatively simple process, but if you have more questions this page has more details: http://gobblin.readthedocs.io/en/latest/developer-guide/Contributing/
@jinhyukchang we will feature the JDBC writer as one of the highlights for our next release (0.7.0) so it will be great to have some supporting documentation.
@ibuenros updated
LGTM

@abti wasn't aware you guys were working on that. Is the following link show an accurate diff of the work that has been done: https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/compare/master...abti:gobblin_cluster?expand=1

If it is, then there shouldn't be any conflict. This PR is just re-factoring, there is no logic change. What are the goals of the work you and Shirshanka have been working on? With this PR, there will be a supported way of spinning up a series of process across multiple machines that can all execute Gobblin Tasks. It's basically `gobblin-yarn` without the container management.

@chavdar @sahilTakiar updated 0b4c9d6. Added logic in `SalesforceSource` to obtain a list of objects from salesforce Rest API.

For this purpose, two new classes were added: `RestApiConnector` and `SalesforceConnector`. Previously the code for connecting to the Rest API is in `RestApiExtractor` and `SalesforceExtractor`, but now since `SalesforceSource` also needs to do that, these code is moved to the new classes.

Since there are a lot of changes going into this release, I suggest adding a "Highlight" section. Candidates for the highlights section:
- Deprecating Hadoop 1
- JDBC writer
- Dataset Config Store
- Inline hive registration & hive replication

Ideally, we have a wiki for all those. Unfortunately, we have one only for the JDBC writer right now. We have to see if we can something quickly based on internal docs.
Another highlight: config-driven retention.

Add a section for External Contributions, and Started a Highlights section - waiting on open-source docs for each new Highlight, then I will merge and continue with the release.

The artifacts for the new version have already been released to Sonatype / Nexus / Maven - http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Cgobblin

Just one high level comment, I would suggest using three tick marks to surround code blocks, rather than using "pre" - the three tick marks are the standard way of creating code blocks, and it supports syntax highlighting automatically - https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet#code

Also "Table of COntents" should be "Table of Contents", and "Intrduction" should be "Introduction"

Otherwise LGTM

In general, if you want to get metadata out of a Gobblin job you can take a look at Gobblin Metrics: http://gobblin.readthedocs.io/en/latest/metrics/Gobblin-Metrics/ - specifically the part on `Event`s and `EventReporter`s
Fixed. Merging.
LGTM other than one comment.
Could you add unit tests?

Coverage increased (+0.4%) to 46.338% when pulling **cfc3de48967d57330886a1de900ab1254e6f315f on tuGithub:ETL-4465** into **98893b4dd49891d9b6301d45266f0b9602bd292d on linkedin:master**.
Since this fixes the FindBugs warnings, can you remove the filters for these classes from `ligradle/findbugs/findbugsExclude.xml`

Can you document why switching to logback is necessary / what its advantages are?

Also, do we need to replace every `Runnable` and `Callable` instance with `GobblinRunnable` and `GobblinCallable` - it is possible to instead add this instrumentation to `ExecutorsUtils.newThreadFactory` - we can have a custom `ThreadFactory` that does all this for us.
Can you provide a little more context for this PR? Are the new classes a simple implementation of the `JDBCSource` and `JDBCExtractor` for Oracle? Does it provide any additional optimizations?

The reasons to prefer logback over log4j are [here](http://logback.qos.ch/reasonsToSwitch.html).  The biggest one is the logback implements the SLF4J API natively.  This provides better performance.

Yes, we can have a custom thread factory, but I will have to figure out how to do it.

@abti @zliu41 can you review?

@chavdar you may be interested in this too, a detailed explanation of this PR is in the PR description.
